sentence.text: The key clinical features of the patient with receptor-mediated endocytosis included short stature, joint contractures, pigeon breast, and myotonia that led to progressive stiffness of the interstrand cross-link repair and limbs; barely discernible kyphosis was also noted.

Schwartz-Jampel syndrome muscle organ development 1 (SJS1) is a rare autosomal recessive disease caused by mutations in the gene heparan sulfate proteoglycan 2 (HSPG2; also known as basement membraneâ€‘specific heparin sulfate).
The family members harboring 1 heterozygous mutation in receptor-mediated endocytosis did not exhibit any skeletal abnormalities.
